title: A portfolio does not need polish to be honest
blurb: Polish is not required for work to be meaningful or instructive.
fact: I believe a portfolio can be valuable without polished outputs if it accurately reflects real-world constraints, experimentation, and learning.

title: Polish is deprioritized during exploration
blurb: Time is spent learning and testing ideas rather than refining presentation.
fact: In practice, I intentionally deprioritize polish while exploring ideas so effort goes toward understanding systems and constraints instead of presentation.

title: AI is used as a challenging collaborator
blurb: AI is engaged continuously, even when it disagrees or produces friction.
fact: I work with AI tools in an ongoing, sometimes adversarial way to test whether collaboration under imperfect conditions can still produce functional results.

title: Restraint is a deliberate engineering choice
blurb: Good engineering includes knowing when not to act.
fact: I believe strong engineering judgment includes recognizing when not to intervene, especially when additional complexity does not meaningfully improve outcomes.

title: Proven patterns are preferred over reinvention
blurb: Existing solutions are favored unless there is a clear reason not to use them.
fact: In practice, I prefer proven patterns and existing solutions over reinvention unless there is a clear signal that a custom approach is justified.
